basics.name: Ziyang Wang
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate
basics.summary: Ph.D. Candidate at Rice University, interesting in machine learning for biomedical and material sciences

location.address: 331 Brockman Hall for Physics, 6100 Main St

work.name: ScopeLab, Rice University
work.summary: Developed innovative machine learning and deep learning platforms integrating Raman spectroscopy, 2D materials, and advanced algorithms to enhance biomarker detection, optical characterization, virus identification, and cancer diagnosis, achieving significant breakthroughs in Alzheimer’s and pancreatic cancer research, with multiple publications, awards, and ongoing clinical collaborations.
highlights: Artificial intelligence, Machine learning, Biomolecule and disease sensing, Materials design, Hyperspectral imaging

work.name: iDeal Technology, LLC (Startup)
work.summary: Led app development and R&D teams to launch a successful mobile app for university students, achieving 15,000+ downloads, 500+ daily active users, and $5 million GMV while integrating advanced recommendation systems and winning the 2022 Asian Future Innovation Challenge.

work.name: DataCVG
work.summary: Designed and built an automated web crawler in Python and extracted 80K+ records from 5000+ listed companies, enhancing stockholder decision-making efficiency.

work.name: ATOZ Information Technology
work.summary: Developed AI-powered inspection services for factory maintenance; created portable augmented reality demos on Microsoft HoloLens, showcasing industrial AI applications to stockholders.

publications.name: Rapid Biomarker Screening of Alzheimer’s Disease by Interpretable Machine Learning and Graphene-Assisted Raman Spectroscopy
publications.summary: Pioneered an interpretable machine learning (ML) biosensing platform integrating Raman spectroscopy and 2D materials, enabling rapid screening of biomarkers of Alzheimer’s disease (AD).

publications.name: Measuring Complex Refractive Index Through Deep-Learning-Enabled Optical Reflectometry
publications.summary: Developed the first-of-its-kind deep learning models to measure optical properties with standard optical microscopes, enabling in-operando characterization of functional and evolving materials.

publications.name: Understanding the excitation wavelength dependence and thermal stability of the SARS-CoV-2 receptor-binding domain using surface-enhanced raman scattering and machine learning
publications.summary: This study utilized surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) and machine learning to analyze and distinguish SARS-CoV-2 RBD with over 95% accuracy, providing insights for variant surveillance and rapid viral protein identification.

publications.name: Accurate virus identification with interpretable Raman signatures by machine learning
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences (PNAS)
publications.summary: Designed convolutional and transformer networks for respiratory virus strain identification and biomolecule recognition, enabling portable virus detection devices.

publications.name: High-Dimensional Spectroscopy Analysis with Machine Learning Techniques
